quiz.title: Chemistry Grade 12: Unit 5 Quiz 6
quiz.subtitle: 5.6: Alcohols Conversion
quiz.subject: Chemistry
quiz.topic: Conversion of alcohols to haloalkanes and other derivatives

questions.question: Which reagent is most commonly used to convert an alcohol into an alkyl chloride while producing only gaseous byproducts ($SO_{2}$ and $HCl$)?
questions.explanation: Thionyl chloride is preferred because the byproducts are gases, which escape the reaction mixture, making the purification of the alkyl chloride much easier.

questions.question: The conversion of an alcohol to an alkyl halide using phosphorus tribromide ($PBr_{3}$) typically follows which mechanism for primary alcohols?
questions.explanation: $PBr_{3}$ converts the hydroxyl group into a good leaving group, which is then displaced by a bromide ion in a backside attack ($S_{N}2$).

questions.question: What is the product of the reaction between an alcohol and phosphorus pentachloride ($PCl_{5}$)?
questions.explanation: The reaction of $R-OH$ with $PCl_{5}$ yields the alkyl chloride along with phosphorus oxychloride ($POCl_{3}$) and hydrogen chloride gas.

questions.question: Why is it difficult to convert a primary alcohol to an alkyl chloride using only concentrated $HCl$ at room temperature?
options: The chloride ion is a relatively weak nucleophile and the primary carbocation is unstable
Primary alcohols are too acidic to react
The $O-H$ bond is too strong to break
$HCl$ acts as an oxidizing agent instead
questions.explanation: Primary alcohols do not form stable carbocations for $S_{N}1$, and $Cl^{-}$ is not strong enough to force $S_{N}2$ without a catalyst like $ZnCl_{2}$ (Lucas reagent).

questions.question: What is the role of anhydrous $ZnCl_{2}$ in the conversion of alcohols to alkyl chlorides?
options: It acts as a Lewis acid catalyst to weaken the $C-O$ bond
It prevents the formation of alkenes
questions.explanation: $ZnCl_{2}$ coordinates with the oxygen atom, making the hydroxyl group a better leaving group for the nucleophilic attack.

questions.question: Which reagent is typically used to prepare alkyl iodides from alcohols?
questions.explanation: $P/I_{2}$ reacts in situ to form $PI_{3}$, which then converts the alcohol into the alkyl iodide.

questions.question: Reaction of an alcohol with a sulfonyl chloride (like $TsCl$) produces a 'tosylate'. What is the purpose of this conversion?
options: To turn the poor leaving group ($-OH$) into an excellent leaving group ($-OTs$)
To make the alcohol more soluble in water
To oxidize the alcohol to a ketone
To protect the alcohol from reacting with bases
questions.explanation: Tosylates are very stable and excellent leaving groups, allowing for further substitution or elimination reactions under mild conditions.

questions.question: What is the organic product when methanol reacts with an excess of $PBr_{3}$?
questions.explanation: One mole of $PBr_{3}$ can convert up to three moles of alcohol into the corresponding alkyl bromide (bromomethane).

questions.question: In the reaction $R-OH + HX \rightarrow R-X + H_{2}O$, which halogen acid is the most reactive?
questions.explanation: The reactivity follows the order $HI > HBr > HCl$ due to the increasing acidity and nucleophilicity of the halide ions as you move down the group.

questions.question: Which of the following is true regarding the stereochemistry of the reaction between a chiral secondary alcohol and $SOCl_{2}$ in the presence of pyridine?
options: It proceeds with inversion of configuration
It proceeds with retention of configuration
No reaction occurs with secondary alcohols
questions.explanation: In the presence of pyridine, the reaction follows an $S_{N}2$ pathway, leading to the inversion of the stereocenter. (Without pyridine, it can follow an $S_{N}i$ pathway with retention).

scoreMessages.90: Excellent! You understand the reagents and mechanisms behind functional group interconversions.
scoreMessages.70: Great job. You have a solid grasp of how to replace the hydroxyl group.
scoreMessages.50: Good effort. Review the specific byproducts of $SOCl_{2}$ and $PCl_{5}$ reactions.
scoreMessages.0: Focus on the reagents used to turn alcohols into haloalkanes.
